required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anti-BCMA CAR-NK Cell Therapy for the Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of Anti-BCMA CAR-NK Therapy in Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to infuse BCMA CAR-NK cells（Umbilical & Cord Blood (CB) Derived CAR-Engineered NK Cells） to the patients with relapsed and refractory multiple myeloma (MM), to assess the safety and feasibility of this strategy. The CAR enables the NK cells to recognize and kill the MM cells by targeting of BCMA, a protein expressed of the surface of the malignant plasma cells in MM patients.

primary_outcome.description: Response assessment per International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) criteria
To characterize the safety, tolerability of Anti-BCMA CAR-NK Cells

secondary_outcome.description: Response assessment per International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) criteria
Response assessment per International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) criteria

arm_group.description: After preconditioning with chemotherapy, the Anti-BCMA CAR-NK Cells will be evaluated

intervention.description: recommendation: 30mg/m2 (D-5~D-3),determined by tumor burden at baseline.
recommendation: 300-500mg/m2 (D-5~D-3),determined by tumor burden at baseline.
